definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: I would knock the door, but you might be scared.
sentences.chinese: 我想叩门，却怕你被我吓着。

sentences.english: Sue was upstairs measuring for blinds when I heard a rap at the door.
sentences.chinese: 苏在楼上测量尺寸，好装窗帘，我听到叩门声。

sentences.english: I can already hear it knocking.
sentences.chinese: 我已经听到了新世界的叩门声。

sentences.english: In something under half an hour there was a knock at the door.
sentences.chinese: 过了半小时不到一些，听到一下叩门声。

sentences.english: Behold I stand at the door and knock.
Here I am! I stand at the door and knock.
The sound of light rapping on the door pulled him out of his daze.
sentences.chinese: 轻叩门的声音把他从幻想中拉回来。

sentences.english: that when he cometh and knocketh, they may open unto him immediately.
sentences.chinese: 他来到叩门，就立刻给他开门。

sentences.english: I stand at the door and knock.
I've seen that the new world is coming.
sentences.chinese: 我已经听到了新世界的叩门声。

sentences.english: Pressing lidless eyes and waiting for a knock upon the door.
sentences.chinese: 揉了难合的眼，等着叩门的一声响。

sentences.english: He heard someone knocking lightly on the door.

definition: door knocker (in the shape of a ring)
lit. woodcutter's family/humble background/poor family background
horizontal bar to hold a door closed (made of wood or metal)/door bolt
to visit/to go to see what's going on
variant of 門閂|门闩[men2 shuan1]
to eavesdrop outside bridal bedchamber (folk custom)
